d.DAO

Interface CustomerDAO

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CustomerDbDAO

    public interface CustomerDAO

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long createCustomer(Customer cust)
      create a customer on the DB.
      java.util.Collection<Customer> getAllCustomers()
      this method gets all the customers from the DB, creates a java bean for each one and adds them to an ArrayList collection.
      java.util.Collection<Coupon> getCoupons(Customer cust)
      this method gets all the coupons of a specified customer from the DB, creates a java bean for each one and adds them to an ArrayList collection.
      java.util.Collection<Coupon> getCouponsByPrice(Customer cust, double price)
      this method gets all the coupons up to a specified price, already purchased by a specific customer.
      java.util.Collection<Coupon> getCouponsByType(Customer cust, CouponType type)
      this method gets all the coupons of a specified type, already purchased by a specific customer.
      Customer getCustomer(long custId)
      this method returns from the DB 1 customer details with the specified customerID, creates a new Customer java bean, sets all of the parameters according to the DB information retrieved, and returns that Customer.
      Customer getCustomerByName(java.lang.String name)
      this method uses a customer name as a received parameter and returns that customer as an object from the DB, if exists.
      Coupon getOnePurchasedCoupon(Customer cust, Coupon coupon)
      this method exists to establish whether a customer has bought a specific coupon in the past, or not.
      boolean login(java.lang.String custName, java.lang.String password)
      this method checks the DB for the specified customer's password.
      void removeCustomer(Customer cust)
      * remove a customer from the DB using it's DB id.
      void removeCustomerWithId(long id)
      ## This is a UTILITY method ## remove a customer from the DB using it's DB id.
      void updateCustomer(Customer cust)
      update a customer (password only) on the DB.
      void updateCustomerWithId(long id, java.lang.String newName, java.lang.String newPassword)
      ## This is a UTILITY method ## update a customer on the DB based on it's DB Id.

    • Method Detail

      • login

        boolean login(java.lang.String custName,
              java.lang.String password)
       throws ConnectionPoolException,
              DAOException
        this method checks the DB for the specified customer's password. returns true if the password matches (case sensitive) to the password passed as a parameter. returns false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        custName -
        password -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ConnectionPoolException
        DAOException

      • createCustomer

        long createCustomer(Customer cust)
             throws ConnectionPoolException,
                    DAOException
        create a customer on the DB. this is also used to get the automatically generated customer ID from the SQL DB, and assign it to this CUSTOMER Java bean.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Throws:
        ConnectionPoolException

      • getOnePurchasedCoupon

        Coupon getOnePurchasedCoupon(Customer cust,
                             Coupon coupon)
                      throws ConnectionPoolException,
                             DAOException
        this method exists to establish whether a customer has bought a specific coupon in the past, or not. it attempts to bring back an existing coupon based on Id, from the customer_coupon JOIN table, on the specific customer Id. if not null, the customer has already bought this coupon and will not be allowed to purchase it again.
        Parameters:
        cust -
        coupon -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ConnectionPoolException
        DAOException

      • getCustomerByName

        Customer getCustomerByName(java.lang.String name)
                    throws ConnectionPoolException,
                           DAOException
        this method uses a customer name as a received parameter and returns that customer as an object from the DB, if exists. it is also used to check name availability before creating a new customer on the DB.
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ConnectionPoolException
        DAOException
